Posts.Content: Christine2000 wrote: Hey all-- I took L-Glutamine on my oncologist's advice to offset neuropathy symptoms from Taxol--it worked! I have a good friend in the UK whose doctors know nothing about this and are eager to learn. First off-- I can't remember the dose! Can someone tell me what their oncologist recommends? and if there is a good study on the internet that would be awesome too-- thank you so much!  Christine-- Aromasin, LE Dx 4/4/2009, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIIA, 1/22 nodes, ER+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: L-Glutamine question Christine2000 CoolBreeze

Posts.Content: Christine2000 wrote: hey all-- I just developed mild lymphedema in my right arm after a double mx on Oct 1st (22 lymph nodes removed). I am seeing a good lymphedema therapist in NYC-- she wants me to wrap for about 2 weeks and then she thinks I can probably just use a compression sleeve for exercise and flying. The problem is that the wrap itches horribly, esp at my elbow. I just had to pull it off (after about 5 hours) and my skin was very inflamed. I am already seeing results though--so I want to keep it up. Any suggestions?? Christine-- Aromasin, LE Dx 4/4/2009, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIIA, 1/22 nodes, ER+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: SO dang itchy from wrapping!! Christine2000 Alyad

Posts.Content: Christine2000 wrote: hey all-- I finished rads december 16 --my onc and I decided to give my body a break and start Zometa in May. I also have a very busy, travel heavy job that I needed to get back to after 6 months of chemo etc (I still worked, just no travel). SO--I went for a dental check-up 2 days ago. And he said I have an "iffy" tooth that he normally would watch for 6 months or so but because of the impending Zometa he wants to root canal it now. ARGH-- I was almost more upset by this news then my BC diagnosis!   seriously, I am panicking a bit. I know its silly but after what I've gone through this just seems so unfair. Please only respond with positive stories! Christine  Christine-- Aromasin, LE Dx 4/4/2009, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIIA, 1/22 nodes, ER+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Zometa...and a root canal Christine2000 KerryMac

Posts.Content: Christine2000 wrote: hey all-- its my birthday today and I have ALOT to be grateful for--I'm in the last 3 weeks of rads, I had a great response to chemo, I have lost 60 pounds since I was diagnosed and honestly look and feel better then I have in years. So why am I so weepy miserable and fearful today? I think part of it is my family expects me to be so strong. My little girl needs to see her mom celebrate her bday with vigor-- but I just want to crawl under the covers...  Christine-- Aromasin, LE Dx 4/4/2009, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIIA, 1/22 nodes, ER+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Baaaad birthday blues Christine2000 Pure

Posts.Content: Christine2000 wrote: hey all-- I had my ovaries out about a month ago and while I was under the Dr checked out my uterus and removed a polyp which turned out to have abnormalities (most likely) caused by tamoxifen.The surgeon wants me to have more surgery and have my uterus removed asap. My oncologist is meeting with me thursday to discuss but has tipped me that she'll probably switch me from tamoxifen to an aromatese inhibitor and recommend that I keep my uterus but keep an eye on it. I've been off tamoxifen for a month so far while this gets hashed out. I hate it when my doctors disagree! Any advice appreciated-- Christine  Christine-- Aromasin, LE Dx 4/4/2009, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIIA, 1/22 nodes, ER+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: trying to decide what to do Christine2000 AnacortesGirl

Posts.Content: Christine2000 wrote: Hey all-- I have been lurking for months but this is the first time I have posted. I was diagnosed in april 09--ALWAYS had a yearly mammogram, but bang-- stage 3 IDC with a LARGE mass (size of a lemon!) with two tumors in it, 2.2 cm and 1.8 --plus lymph involvement. YES I felt it but I have very large breasts and a history of fibroids and all kinds of lumpy stuff. I noticed it in october, showed it to my gyno in november and she said to not worry-- and I took her at her word. Cut to mammogram and sonogram in march and the nurse whispering to me "honey-- I think it looks bad! you should come back for a biopsy as soon as you can!!" SO-- chemo first to shrink my big a** cancer. 4 tx A/C, 3 taxol, switch to 9 abraxane.  Chemo ended last week and I had my MRI a day later-- all cancer gone! tumor TOTALLY disappeared. My surgeon says not so fast, there may still be stuff in there. I decided on a double masectomy with no reconstruction. That is thursday-- kind of anxious! Still though-- can't believe I have come this far. And of course: radiation after. So I get the whoooole cancer package.. Thank you all. your posts have helped me so much.  Christine-- Aromasin, LE Dx 4/4/2009, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIIA, 1/22 nodes, ER+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Finished Chemo and heading to surgery Christine2000 DCMom

(and then it will all finally hit me and I'll have a nervous breakdown--right?) christine  Christine-- Aromasin, LE Dx 4/4/2009, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIIA, 1/22 nodes, ER+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: almost DONE! Christine2000 Gitane

Posts.Content: Christine2000 wrote: I had LVNT surgery in June (another story--another forum!) and as a result went off Aromasin for almost a month. I dropped 5 pounds without doing a thing, started sleeping 100x times better and my partner swears my mood swings disappeared. I went back on after the surgery but I saw my oncologist today and she said I should go off it at least for the summer. Wondering about other people's experiences! Christine-- Aromasin, LE Dx 4/4/2009, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIIA, 1/22 nodes, ER+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: after 6 1/2 years-- I'm off Aromasin Christine2000 Annette_U

Posts.Content: Christine2000 wrote: I was in a meeting and I brushed my arm across my chest-- and felt a lump on my scar line. I tried to focus on the meeting while my mind raced ahead to "its back!" and I saw the future unfold in biopsies, more chemo, oh and I'll lose my hair again...FINALLY got to the bathroom and lifted my shirt to take a look and discovered... a mosquito bite! Christine-- Aromasin, LE Dx 4/4/2009, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIIA, 1/22 nodes, ER+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: A scare.. Christine2000 lamuso

Posts.Content: Christine2000 wrote: Hey all-- I was diagnosed in april and have done 5 months of chemo (A/C,taxol/abraxane). Finally heading to surgery next thursday-- after a lot of thought and soul searching I decided I did not want reconstruction-- I have a small child, I run my own business which requires a lot of travel--I don't want to have another surgery. I have had Very Big breasts my whole life. They have long been a source of discomfort for me and I am honestly thinking I will be relieved to have none at all. But I would love to hear from other women who have made this decision. Christine-- Aromasin, LE Dx 4/4/2009, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIIA, 1/22 nodes, ER+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Surgery on Oct 1st-- double masectomy, no reconstruction.. Christine2000 delaine

Posts.Content: Christine2000 wrote: Hey all-- I finished rads yesterday (yay!) and am starting a new regime of supplements that includes anti-oxidants that I couldn't take during chemo and rads. I am working with a nutritionist--he is NOT an anti-western medicine guy, which I would not feel comfortable with. here's what I am doing: Pro-biotic greens drink green tea tablets DIM fish oil AHCC A multivitamin called Advaclear D3 and calcium   and of course--Tamoxifen! Christine-- Aromasin, LE Dx 4/4/2009, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIIA, 1/22 nodes, ER+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: what supplements are you taking post-treatment? Christine2000 DCMom
